Package org.eclipse.mosaic.rti.api

Interface FederationManagement

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DistributedFederationManagement, LocalFederationManagement
    public interface FederationManagement
    The federation management is responsible for the administration of the simulators and their ambassadors.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addFederate​(FederateDescriptor handle)
      Adds a federate to the federation.
      void createFederation()
      Creates an empty federation.
      FederateAmbassador getAmbassador​(String federateId)
      Returns a reference to the ambassador associated with the given federate id.
      Collection<FederateAmbassador> getAmbassadors()
      Returns a collection of all ambassadors associated with joined federates.
      String getFederationId()
      Returns the id of the simulated federation.
      boolean isFederateJoined​(String federateId)
      Checks whether a federate is joined or not.
      void setWatchdog​(WatchDog watchDogThread)
      Sets the WatchDog which detects broken federates.
      void stopFederation()
      Stops the federation.

    • Method Detail

      • createFederation

        void createFederation()
        Creates an empty federation. After calling this method it is possible for federates to join the federation.

      • addFederate

        void addFederate​(FederateDescriptor handle)
          throws Exception
        Adds a federate to the federation. This method can be called either before or during runtime of the simulation of the federation.
        Parameters:
        handle - object containing all data that are necessary to manage the lifecycle of a federate
        Throws:
        Exception

      • isFederateJoined

        boolean isFederateJoined​(String federateId)
        Checks whether a federate is joined or not.
        Parameters:
        federateId - unique string identifying the federate
        Returns:
        a boolean, whether a federate is joined or not

      • getAmbassador

        FederateAmbassador getAmbassador​(String federateId)
        Returns a reference to the ambassador associated with the given federate id.
        Parameters:
        federateId - unique string identifying the federate
        Returns:
        ambassador associated with the given federate id

      • getAmbassadors

        Collection<FederateAmbassador> getAmbassadors()
        Returns a collection of all ambassadors associated with joined federates.
        Returns:
        collection of all ambassadors

      • stopFederation

        void stopFederation()
             throws Exception
        Stops the federation. All resources of federates are freed. Afterwards, no new federates are allowed to join.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getFederationId

        String getFederationId()
        Returns the id of the simulated federation.
        Returns:
        the id of the simulated federation.

      • setWatchdog

        void setWatchdog​(WatchDog watchDogThread)
        Sets the WatchDog which detects broken federates.
